steps.title: Get help from someone else if youâ€™re struggling to create a caption.
steps.content: Get help from someone else if youâ€™re struggling to create a caption. Choose an author, celebrity, or any other public figure you admire, and share their words for an easy birthday caption. Here are some funny, reflective, and inspirational options: â€œLet them eat cake.â€ â€”Marie Antoinette â€œYou donâ€™t get older, you get better.â€ â€”Shirley Bassey â€œEvery birthday is a gift. Every day is a gift.â€ â€”Aretha Franklin â€œWe turn not older with years, but newer every day.â€ â€”Emily Dickinson â€œLearn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.â€ â€”Albert Einstein â€œThe best birthdays of all are those that havenâ€™t arrived yet.â€ â€”Robert Orben â€œThe older you get the better you get, unless you are a banana.â€ â€”Betty White â€œWhatever with the past has gone, the best is always yet to come.â€ â€”Lucy Larcom â€œYou are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.â€ â€”Les Brown â€œBirthdays come but once a year, celebrate and be of good cheer.â€ â€”Robert Rivers â€œFrom our birthday, until we die, is but the winking of an eye.â€ â€”William Butler Yeats â€œAs soon as I saw you I knew a grand adventure was about to happen.â€ â€”A.A. Milne â€œCount your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.â€ â€”John Lennon â€œThe secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly, and lie about your age.â€ â€”Lucille Ball â€œWe grow neither better nor worse as we get old, but more like ourselves.â€ â€”Bernard Baruch â€œThe more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.â€ â€”Oprah Winfrey â€œToday is the oldest you have been and the youngest you will ever be again. Make the most of it!â€ â€”Nicky Gumbel â€œLive the full life of the mind, exhilarated by new ideas, intoxicated by the romance of the unusual.â€ â€”Ernest Hemingway â€œLet us never know what old age is. Let us know the happiness time brings, not count the years.â€ â€”Decimus Magnus Ausonius â€œIn other words, live vicariously, beautifully, and excitedly, discover, love, dare, and act as there is nothing to lose.â€ â€”Andy Hertz

steps.title: Try to craft a birthday caption thatâ€™s short, sweet, and snappy.
steps.content: Try to craft a birthday caption thatâ€™s short, sweet, and snappy. According to social media expert Kasey Dunn, your caption should be concise to â€œcaptivate the audience in the first eight secondsâ€ of seeing your post. After a few lines of text, Instagram hides the rest of your caption, so include the most eye-catching details at the beginning. Most users wonâ€™t read a lengthy caption, so when in doubt, keep it sweet and simple. Play around with different birthday-related emojis to add more personality to your caption. Some great options include: ğŸ‰, ğŸ¥³, ğŸ‚, and ğŸŒŸ! Include questions in your caption to increase engagement . For instance, you could caption your post with â€œWhat should I add to my birthday checklist?â€ or â€œAm I officially an adult now?â€ Social media and digital marketing consultant Candace Gasper also recommends â€œseeing whatâ€™s trending in pop culture and utilizing it in your post.â€ If thereâ€™s a viral song or meme, for example, you could reference it in your caption.

steps.title: Post a selfie, group shot, or photo of a birthday cake on the big day.
steps.content: Post a selfie, group shot, or photo of a birthday cake on the big day. Whether youâ€™re posting a birthday shout out for yourself or for a loved one, feel free to upload your favorite image of the birthday boy or girl. If they donâ€™t post a lot of photos of themselves online, reach out to them first or post a picture of a birthday cake to share your well wishes. If you really want to go all out, stage a birthday-themed photoshoot at home with balloons, cake, and 20 candles!
